page.title: 01Carlton-Pockley-Riccal Wood
page.content: This area is typical of the North York Moors National park in which it lies. The majority of the area is level, intensively farmed land with a band of conferous and mixed woodland running North-South through the centre. There are only 2 small villages, populations around 100, neither with any services. There are many small farms but all are actively involved with either growing crops or keeping sheep. Many of the farms are also open to tourists in th summer as places to stay. The woods contain many public footpaths and Riccal Wood in paticular is popular with walkers. Due to its physical nature there are many fine view-points over the surrounding countryside.
